titles.title: Expressing the Sense of Congress that the United States needs an industrial policy with regard to automobile, aerospace, shipping, and steel industries, which are vital to national and economic security.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Commerce, Trade and Consumer Protection.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

bill.summary: 5/14/2009--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the House of Representatives that the United States needs an industrial policy that corrects widespread disinvestment in its productive capacity, preserves core industries, positions core industries as global leaders in manufacturing goods necessary to support clean and renewable energy development, and restores the possibility of middle class incomes to working people.
